alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 06 at 2:48PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: Hydrologic Outlook National Weather Service Pendleton OR 250 PM PDT Thu Apr 6 2023 ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS EXPECTED DUE TO SNOWMELT AND RAIN... Small streams and large rivers coming out of the mountains will see rises over the weekend and through the first half of next week. Snow levels will rise over the weekend into early next week as a ridge of high pressure brings warmer conditions to the region. A fast moving weather system brings rain through Friday. This will be followed by a slower system later Sunday through Monday night producing a more prolonged rain event with the high snow levels. These conditions will result in the rise of streams and rivers over the weekend that are expected to peak around Tuesday followed by the return of cooler conditions and lower snow levels for the middle of next week. Some rivers, streams, and creeks could approach bankfull as a result of this weather pattern but no flooding is expected at this time. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Friday afternoon with any other pertinent information.
